Hello, your delivery is expected to arrive between the 5th and 8th.

Hi hanhamreds@sky. com,      First, please plug the USB cable into a USB 3.0 blue port on the back of your computer and avoid using any USB hubs. Next, use a wire to connect any metal screw on the pedal to the grounding screw on the main control box. Please ensure the connection is solid, as paint may affect grounding.  Then, I recommend performing a manual firmware update: Settings → Update → Manual Firmware Update → pedals-firmware → pedals-plusx.sfu  After completing the update, unplug and replug the USB, then reconnect the power and test again. If the issue persists, please provide the following:    A screenshot of the pedal signal in SIMSONN Manager to verify if the signal is normal.    A screenshot of the vibration feedback interface showing whether the device is recognized by the computer.

Hi hanhamreds@sky. com,  Please use a toothpick or screwdriver to press and hold the small button inside the hole on the side of the control box, then reconnect the USB cable. The software should enter recovery mode. Next, go to Settings → Update → Manual Firmware Update → Pedals → Firmware → Pedals → plusX.sfu and try updating the firmware manually. If the issue persists, we recommend installing Todesk (no registration required). Simply provide your ID and temporary access code, and we can schedule a time to assist you remotely.      https://dl.todesk.com/windows/ToDesk_Setup.exe
